00032     HistogramCollection_t(const std::string &collection_name,
00033                           const EVENT::StringVec &name_list, UInt_t n_hist,

00057     HistogramCollection_t(const std::string &collection_name,
00058                           const EVENT::StringVec &name_list, const lcio::IntVec &n_hist_list,
00059                           const HistPar &par)
00060       : _histogramCol(0),
00061         _majorIndex(0)
00062     {
00063       createHistograms(collection_name,name_list, n_hist_list, par);
00064       //    __instances++;
00065     }
00066 
00067 
00074     HistogramCollection_t(lcio::LCCollection *histograms, lcio::IntVec *indices)
00075       :_histogramCol(histograms),
00076        _majorIndex(0)
00077     {
00078       //    stat_copy(_histogramCol);
00079       if (indices) {
00080         if (indices->back()<histograms->getNumberOfElements()) {
00081           indices->push_back(histograms->getNumberOfElements());
00082         }
00083         // unfortunately there is currently no way to get the array which is attached to the LCIO collection.
00084         // so we have to maintain our own copy
00085         _majorIndex=new lcio::IntVec;
00086         _majorIndex->assign(indices->begin(),indices->end());
00087         histograms->parameters().setValues(__majorIndexParameterName,*indices);
00088       }
00089       //    __instances++;
00090     };
00091 
00098     HistogramCollection_t(lcio::LCCollection *histograms)
00099       : _histogramCol(histograms),
00100         _majorIndex(0)
00101     {
00102       //    stat_copy(_histogramCol);
00103       if (histograms->parameters().getNInt(__majorIndexParameterName)>0) {
00104         _majorIndex=new lcio::IntVec;
00105         histograms->parameters().getIntVals(__majorIndexParameterName,*_majorIndex);
00106       }
00107       //    __instances++;
00108     };
00109 
00112     HistogramCollection_t(const HistogramCollection_t &a)
00113       :_histogramCol(a._histogramCol),
00114        _majorIndex(0)
00115     {
00116       //    stat_copy(_histogramCol);
00117       if (a._majorIndex) {
00118         _majorIndex=new lcio::IntVec;
00119         _majorIndex->assign(a._majorIndex->begin(),a._majorIndex->end());
00120       }
00121       //    __instances++;
00122     };
00123 
00124 
00125     ~HistogramCollection_t() {
00126       // the histogram may not be owned by this wrapper, so it must not be deleted automatically.
00127       // The major index is always owned by this wrapper, so it should be deleted
00128       // The collections must be deleted manually. Otherwise whenever the HistogramCollection is passed
00129       // by value the collection will be deleted.
00130       delete _majorIndex;
00131     }
00132 
00133 
00136     HistogramCollection_t() : _histogramCol(0),_majorIndex(0) {};
00137 
00141     void deleteCollection() {
00142       //    stat_remove(_histogramCol);
00143       delete _histogramCol;
00144       _histogramCol=0;
00145       delete _majorIndex;
00146       _majorIndex=0;
00147     };
00148 
00149     void deleteSharedStorage() {
00150       deleteCollection();
00151     }

00207     UInt_t n() const {
00208       return _histogramCol->getNumberOfElements();
00209     }
00210 
00213     bool is2D() const {
00214       return _majorIndex && _majorIndex->size()>1;
00215     };
00216 
00219     UInt_t nMajor() const {
00220 #ifdef BOUNDARY_CHECK
00221       assert(_majorIndex);
00222 #endif
00223       return _majorIndex->size()-1;
00224     };
00227     UInt_t nMinor(UInt_t major_index) const {
00228       return (*_majorIndex)[major_index+1]-(*_majorIndex)[major_index];
00229     };
00230 
00233     const FloatHistogram1D *histogram(UInt_t index) const {
00234 #ifdef BOUNDARY_CHECK
00235       if (index>=static_cast<UInt_t>(_histogramCol->getNumberOfElements())) {
00236         std::stringstream message;
00237         message << "Range error accessing histogram " << index << ". Ther are only "
00238                 << _histogramCol->getNumberOfElements() << " histograms in the collection.";
00239         throw std::range_error(message.str());
00240       }
00241 #endif
00242       return dynamic_cast<FloatHistogram1D*>(_histogramCol->getElementAt(index));
00243     };
00244 
00247     FloatHistogram1D *histogram(UInt_t index)  {
00248 #ifdef BOUNDARY_CHECK
00249       if (index>=static_cast<UInt_t>(_histogramCol->getNumberOfElements())) {
00250         std::stringstream message;
00251         message << "Range error accessing histogram " << index << ". Ther are only "
00252                 << _histogramCol->getNumberOfElements() << " histograms in the collection.";
00253         throw std::range_error(message.str());
00254       }
00255 #endif
00256       return dynamic_cast<FloatHistogram1D*>(_histogramCol->getElementAt(index));
00257     };
00258 
00261     FloatHistogram1D *histogram(UInt_t major_index, UInt_t minor_index)  {
00262 #ifdef BOUNDARY_CHECK
00263       if (!_majorIndex) {
00264         throw std::logic_error("A major index was specified but the index collection does not exist.");
00265       }
00266 
00267       if (major_index>=_majorIndex->size()) {
00268         std::stringstream message;
00269         message << "Major index " << major_index << " out of ranger. The index collection contains only "
00270                 << _majorIndex->size() << " indices.";
00271         throw std::range_error(message.str());
00272       }
00273 #endif
00274 
00275       UInt_t index=(*_majorIndex)[major_index]+minor_index;
00276 
00277 #ifdef BOUNDARY_CHECK
00278       if (index>=static_cast<UInt_t>(_histogramCol->getNumberOfElements())) {
00279         std::stringstream message;
00280         message << "Range error accessing histogram " << index << ". Ther are only "
00281                 << _histogramCol->getNumberOfElements() << " histograms in the collection.";
00282         throw std::range_error(message.str());
00283       }
00284 #endif
00285       return dynamic_cast<FloatHistogram1D*>(_histogramCol->getElementAt(index));
00286     };
00287 
00290     const FloatHistogram1D *histogram(UInt_t major_index, UInt_t minor_index) const {
00291 #ifdef BOUNDARY_CHECK
00292       if (!_majorIndex) {
00293         throw std::logic_error("A major index was specified but the index collection does not exist.");
00294       }
00295 
00296       if (major_index>=_majorIndex->size()) {
00297         std::stringstream message;
00298         message << "Major index " << major_index << " out of ranger. The index collection contains only "
00299                 << _majorIndex->size() << " indices.";
00300         throw std::range_error(message.str());
00301       }
00302 #endif
00303 
00304       UInt_t index=(*_majorIndex)[major_index]+minor_index;
00305 
00306 #ifdef BOUNDARY_CHECK
00307       if (index>=static_cast<UInt_t>(_histogramCol->getNumberOfElements())) {
00308         std::stringstream message;
00309         message << "Range error accessing histogram " << index << ". Ther are only "
00310                 << _histogramCol->getNumberOfElements() << " histograms in the collection.";
00311         throw std::range_error(message.str());
00312       }
00313 #endif
00314       return dynamic_cast<FloatHistogram1D*>(_histogramCol->getElementAt(index));
00315     };

00321     const std::string &getName(UInt_t major_index) const {
00322       if (_nameList.empty()) copyNames();
00323       if (_nameList.size()==1) {
00324         return _nameList[0];
00325       }
00326 #ifdef BOUNDARY_CHECK
00327       assert( major_index < _nameList.size());
00328 #endif
00329       return _nameList[major_index];
00330     };

00351     void copyNames() const {
00352       if (_nameList.empty()) {
00353         _histogramCol->getParameters().getStringVals(__histogramNameParameterName,_nameList);
00354         if (_nameList.empty()) {
00355           _nameList.push_back(__defaultHistogramName);
00356         }
00357       }
00358     }
